Excellent game offering a good mental challenge yet really funny.
For anyone who wishes to have a good laugh.
Awesome Story, single Player and Coop, one of the best freakin' Games that i ever played
portals

Far better than Portal 1, if you liked that game you have to get 2.
Not only does it feature an amazing singleplayer experience better, in my opinion, than Valve's other works; but it also adds in a co-op mode that is just great.
I can't think of any reason not to try Portal 2, even if a couple of the puzzles were a little frustrating.
a great game, worth buying.
Almost as grand an experience as Portal 1. And lots longer. A great buy in either case, as it is leaps and bounds above the competition.
Du magst Puzzles, Spass und das ganze noch im Coop? Dann ist das genau das Game für dich! Bis jetzt mein Spiel des Jahres 2011.

Meiner Meinung nach das beste Valve-Spiel, was vor allem durch die fesselnde Story mit ihren lustigen und überraschenden Wendungen kommt. Ganz zu schweigen vom Multiplayer, der sehr viel wert auf Teamwork legt. Alles in allem ein Meilenstein und sehr empfehlenswert.

Un peu court et des niveaux pas trop compliqués mais excellent dans la narration. Si on a aimé le 1, on ne peut pas être déçu par ce second épisode.

Yo dudes, I'm here to tell you about a rad game called Poht - Ah - LoL 2 and let me tell you it's the best greifing simulator you'll play this year. This game has been finely crafted by the makers of Hat Masters Inc. to provide you with perfect oppertunities to humilate, murder or confuse your friends. Each corner having a new way of drowning burning or bullet riddening someone. But don't just trust me, listen to these first hand accounts of this games greatness.

" I liked the part where I dropped fifty feet getting shot by bullets down the way and then burning in acid when you closed that portal on me. " - Tom Servo

" Why am I playing this again? " - Tom Servo

" Kick Hopper is awesome!!111 " Tom Servo

So what are you waiting for? Buy Portal 2 Today!
Portal 2 - A great continuation of the epic award winning game Portal. The series is fun and humerous, a must buy.
It's good and I need co-op buddies
You really really need to play this game. Seriously.
The sequel to Portal proves to be quite the sequel indeed. Massive amount of levels, co-op, and humor to fill your gameplay experience. Great addition to any game collection.

After several years of waiting, we finally got the long awaited sequel to the surprise hit puzzle game Portal that was included in The Orange Box.
Once again you play as Chell and she is still trapped in the Aperture Science labs, however she is not alone. A Personality Core by the name of Wheatley, who speaks with a british accent, wants to help Chell get out of the place.
However, while they're trying to escape, Wheatley accidently reactivates GLaDOS who still remembers what Chell did to her and now Chell must do the tests once again.
Thankfully, the iconic Portal Gun is still available to Chell and even more things that'll help her pass the tests and hopefully escape from GLaDOS once and for all.
Do not hesitate, buy this.
To quote the good Gabe, worth the wait.
Parce qu'à deux, c'est mieux :D
this game is aweome everyone should get it
one of the best games in the history of games.
Quite simply one of the best games I've played in years.
Mejorando lo ya de por si genial

This is the most awaited game 2011, and boy, does it deliver. Awesome, polished, one of the best games ever made and hands down the best game I've played in the last 10 years. Excellent. Awesome. Buy this - you won't be dissapointed!!!!
Really fun game, great story, longer than the first Portal, and awesome co-op gameplay.
Simplemente vale lo que cuesta y mas, si te gustó Portal no dudes en comprar este juego junto a un amigo para disfrutar de su modo cooperativo.
Go and get it already!
one of the best games i ever played!!!

Alright, we know that living up to the original is impossible. It was tight, sharp and induced enough paranoid to drive me away from baked goods for a while. I was so happy with the sequel though. It was detailed, broad in scope and still had enough twists to keep me happy. And it was a longer experience, which was all I really wanted. More portal!

It's better than the first one I reckon.
This game makes you feel really smart.
Speedy thing goes in. Speedy thing comes out.
get it

Valve's finest game to date. Much improved over the already great Portal 1.

With the new built in level editor, there's now almost infinitly more puzzles for the game.

The best puzzle-action-adventure game out there. Valve made another smash hit. The writing is excellent and funny. Co-op is a blast! Buy it! Now you can even create your own test chambers and play  some from the community. As long as you have imagination, you can bag more hours on the game.
An absolute masterpiece that will most certainly stand the test of time.
Better than the original. A must own for any PC gamer.

Portal 2 is a great followup to the original.  Note:  I haven't really gotten into multiplayer with it

New puzzles, new puzzle mechanics, and in addition to the return of GLaDOS's witty dialog, we also have Wheatley, who can be really funny at times.

Cave Johnson is pretty funny as well.
Science is fun.
Must-Have for any fan of the original game...

Muy bueno este juego.. hay que ser estratega para tirar los portales xD
:3
<Subject Name Here> You have been invited to play an innovative experience created by your friends at Aperture Science!
An absolute must for any fans of the first, and also anyone who likes potatoes.

★★★★☆ Very Good!

[h1]Puzzles[/h1]

Portal 2 is everything a video game should be. It's thrilling at times, fun and hilarious from start to finish, entertaining, the perfect balance between realism and fiction and it's simply a work of scientific art.

The only minor downsides are the frequent loadingscreens and the Advanced Testchambers that were left out, but thanks to Steam's Workshop you can create your own maps and play those of others, adding countless hours of fan dedication to both singpleplayer and cooperative experiences.

With very loveable characters, a wonderful story and very original ideas, Valve once again shows us what they have to offer.

You know what !

Best game ever! :D
Un juego que se tiene que jugar si o si, tanto su modo solo como coop.
Un des meilleur jeu auquel j'ai joué, drôle et qui fait réflechir!
Give me a high five.
Portal 2 is a great game, great mix of puzzles, and humour. The singleplayer is like 6 -7 hours long and coop is like 3 - 4 hours long, not to mention all the custom campaigns that are coming.
Quite simply the best AAA game of the year.

Best single-player experience I had since... I don't even remember. Usually the first game on my mind when people ask me for best single-player games.

This game takes place a "few" years after Portal. But this time everything is run down because of lack of maintenance. When you first wake up you'll meet Wheatley that will help you the first hour or so of gameplay. But after that the story get's a serious twist and you're back in the old Aperture Science center a few kilometers under ground and you now have to work your way up to the newer installments. During this you'll see many of the phases Aperture Science went trough along the ages.
Stunning!

The game is off the chain ... too bad its too easy!
A great follow up to Portal. Amazing Single-Player and really fun Co-Op.
Pretty awsome everything!

Die Metascore spricht für sich. Meinentwegen hätte Portal 2 sogar realistische 98/100 Punkte bekommen können. Atmosphere, Engine, Story, Sound, Grafik, Spielmodi - Dieses Spiel ist einfach nur zu empfehlen. Persönliche einschätzung: 100/100 Punkte
33% off today only I think awesome game
Simply a must-have game! Pick up the bundle and play through the original Portal first. That way the squeal-with-delight geeking-out moments of the sequel won't be lost on you.

If Portal was a tech demo of an amazing concept, Portal 2 is the full, golden release of it.  A tour de force of alternative first-gameplay, Portal 2 clocks in at 6-8 hours of awesome single player puzzles and another 4-6 hours of multiplayer.  More content is planned by Valve, and the modding community has made some stunning levels on their own.  Definitely worth picking up, especially if you have a friend who has it already.  They'll be wanting that Professor Portal achievement.

If you liked the first Portal, you won't be too disappointed.  Portal 2 is definitely more polished and refined, both visually and gameplay-wise.  The new mechanics involving things like gels and excursion tunnels work well in the Portal environment, and even better when manipulated with the handheld portal device (portal gun).  I'll admit that I expected more of a challenge like in the first Portal, but was surprised when I passed everything without a problem.  The single player campaign is also more linear with the puzzles; I couldn't find alternative solutions to solve chambers like in the first game.  The single player portion seems to primarily exist to expand on the Portal world.  It does so wonderfully.

The two-player campaign is where the real challenges are.  These puzzles were a blast to play.  Unfortunately, this portion is short and has little replay value.  Hopefully this will be changed in the future, because these were the puzzles I expected of the single player mode.
Tout simplement génial... suite directe du 1 (auquel il vaut mieux avoir joué pour profiter pleinement du scénar), il le surpasse à tous points de vue et sublime le concept o/.

I must admit I am a Portal fanboy so this may not be the most balanced recommendation but it also meant that I had very high expectations of this game. The single player game maintains the charm and the fun of the first game whilst being much longer. The multiplayer is amazing fun when neither of you have played it before but it loses the magic on subsequent play throughs.
If Pixar made a video game this would be it.
Gaming quality at it's finest. Play it.
goty

Portal 2 managed to strike a balance with surprising players with more of the new, while still preserving the nostalgia of the first Portal.
The singleplayer campaign was incredibly well done with being taken to the roots of Aperture Science and providing a few plot twists along the way. We meet our favourite mad A.I., GLaDOS, as well as some new faces packed full of personality.
The coop campaign, though not as long and in depth as singleplayer, was an interesting new addition. It made players have to think with portals in a new, more cooperative way giving puzzle solving an interesting twist. A laugh is never too far away in coop with failure often being shrugged off with a laughter between you and your buddy.
All in all this game is highly recommended. Fantastic story, superbly written characters, wonderful art style, and gameplay that will blow your puzzle-solving mind.
It maybe a system hog, but it's a helluva good game. Even if you havn't played the first portal (why havn't you already?) this is a must.
This game is for the cubes like me :D The cooperative (multiplayer) game wasn't as much fan as before in any other games!

Esse jogo está para Portal assim como Terminator 2 está para Terminator.
É uma evolução completa em todos os aspectos do antecessor, o jogo está maior e melhor elaborado, a storyline mais profunda e envolvente, cada puzzle é original, único e desafiador. Jogue o co-op com um amigo. Vale muito o seu tempo.

Great fun, with a portal gun.  
In order to progress thru Co Op, you have to play thru the same maps which make it repettive.   But in saying that its a great idea and a great game.  
Hope there are future co op maps.
More classic, more challenging and more fun.
a unforgetable jouney you can not forget
Why would anyone *not* have this?
If you don't buy this game, now I only want you gone.

Portal 2 takes what was a short, yet awesome game, and adds more of basically everything. More story, more game content, more challenge, and more variety. Additionally, I've heard rumors about free DLC being a possibility, adding Challenge maps similar to what was in Portal. Though soome might say it isn't worth the $50 it costs, I'd strongly disagree.

The game isn't witthout it's flaws, obviously. Some of the solutions to the later levels can be downright frustrating to discover, and if you don't have many Steam friends, you'll have a hell of a time participating in the Co-op mode.

Overall, I'd highly recommend this game, but make sure you've got people to play with, otherwise the Co-Op mode will be a waste.
One of the best games on Steam. Tremendous replay quality. Extensive single, and multiplayer content, new free dlc coming in summer, brilliant.
Lindo, mais que divino, mais que demais, SENSACIONAL! SPAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACE Valve ftw
If you're not really into multiplayer, this isn't worth the 50 dollar pricetag.  The single-player game is good, but not 50 dollars good.  15 dollars good, maybe.
Great Sequel. Shows alot of Aperture's history. Great single player and Co-Op play.
